channel.title: Most overpriced products?
channel.description:
I was scrolling through the MSN news and found this!
http://money.msn.com/shopping-deals/article.aspx?post=3e3adf27-dfba-4999-981d-078c642e0886&gt1=33029
Just something I thought I should share ahaha. Make sure you smuggle a coke bottle and some kettle corn into the movie theaters!

item.title: Most overpriced products?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:36, topic:462217”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=565172.msg4112931#msg4112931 date=1348711281]

Nothing is over priced… if you can sell it for $5 to an idiot… than it is worth $5.

That is a terrible measure of value. In order to really get a value of something, we need to consider how much money we can get out of it.

Let say I sell you a barrel of oil for $150, you agree with my trade. Does your barrel of oil have a value of $150? No, the value of your barrel is still $110.
[/quote]
Wrong… Money is just there to make exchange easier. If someone is willing to spend $150 on a barrel of oil, then that barrel of oil is worth $150. It doesn’t mean that the other ones are, but that one definitely is.[/quote]
Another stupid boy. If you can’t sell the barrel to anyone else for $150, it isn’t worth $150.
Let me give you another example. Somebody sells you a barrel of oil for $70. Do you now have a barrel worth $150 and one worth $70? It makes no sense.

And to make the case much more insane. I sell you a $10 bill for $20. Would the bill double in value because you bought it for $20?

Read full topic

item.title: Most overpriced products?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:14, topic:462217”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=565172.msg4112922#msg4112922 date=1348710892]
Nothing is over priced… if you can sell it for $5 to an idiot… than it is worth $5.
[/quote]
That is a terrible measure of value. In order to really get a value of something, we need to consider how much money we can get out of it.

Let say I sell you a barrel of oil for $150, you agree with my trade. Does your barrel of oil have a value of $150? No, the value of your barrel is still $110.[/quote]
Wrong… Money is just there to make exchange easier. If someone is willing to spend $150 on a barrel of oil, then that barrel of oil is worth $150. It doesn’t mean that the other ones are, but that one definitely is.

@RandQm wrote:

My ASUS notebook was 999€,
yesterday I was in the store and saw a mac with exactly the same specs as my notebook for 3000€
note: I bought mine over a year ago.

/

Gas and condoms are the two biggest overpriced common items in my opinion.

item.title: Most overpriced products?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Fat Cookies:

Unsurprisingly Mac Pro’s are stupidly more expensive then a home built counterpart and as with any Apple product, you ain’t going to be able to replace/upgrade it cheap…

Actually, Mac Pros are very upgradable. The chassis was actually designed to be rather friendly to upgrades, it is rather nice. Though, Apple have refused to upgrade the Mac Pros for a while now, yet haven’t dropped the price so they are ridiculously overpriced. But I imagine that is because they’re a rather niche product.

Read full topic

item.title: Most overpriced products?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:31, topic:462217”][quote author=Niall link=topic=565172.msg4117224#msg4117224 date=1349192203]
I SERIOUSLY doubt you’ll find the same model in the states for £600 cheaper

comparing two similar models on amazon, the amazon model was cheaper by about £200 but that didn’t include any sales tax, the uk model did
[/quote]
There are annoying amounts of variations of this laptop, I might’ve got mixed up and maybe exaggerated a little, but US is still cheaper than UK even without VAT.[/quote]

we also get a better wage in comparison

Read full topic

item.title: Most overpriced products?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:25, topic:462217”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=565172.msg4112737#msg4112737 date=1348696559]
I didn’t watch the video but just sharing something I realised last weekend. Condoms from vending machines are pricey these days £5 for 3 :|. That seems overpriced to me. Mind you, I’d rather pay £5 than hundreds of thousands raising a kid until they were self supporting.
[/quote]

the uk nhs gives out free condoms, barring that you can buy them at significantly marked down prices from http://www.freedoms-shop.nhs.uk/ - on the order of 36 condoms for a mere £7[/quote]

Yeah but I don’t like the whole walking into the clinic to pick them up although I may buy them from there. Thanks Niall

Read full topic

item.title: Most overpriced products?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Ruby:

I didn’t watch the video but just sharing something I realised last weekend. Condoms from vending machines are pricey these days £5 for 3 :|. That seems overpriced to me. Mind you, I’d rather pay £5 than hundreds of thousands raising a kid until they were self supporting.

the uk nhs gives out free condoms, barring that you can buy them at significantly marked down prices from http://www.freedoms-shop.nhs.uk/ - on the order of 36 condoms for a mere £7

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:11, topic:462217”]European farmers had to get rid of pigs because it got to expensive to feed them. This again gave a 10% decrease in supply, and the bacon prices might increase by 50%.

Increase price of pig food is because of because failed crops in China, Russia and US. It is not overpriced, it is supply and demand that do its work.[/quote]

more so with beef, the general price for animal produce can still depend on droughts etc that happen 2-3 years prior, it’s a cycle that with a drought you have to kill livestock early resulting in less produce, less herd for next years breeding etc

Read full topic

item.title: Most overpriced products?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:18, topic:462217”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=565172.msg4112753#msg4112753 date=1348697802]
Apple products aren’t in this, must be bad
[/quote]

Well to be honest, expensive macbooks, ipads, iphone’s etc are understandable. Although it might not fit everyone’s taste, all these products are a marvellous piece of design - it’s debatable whether these products are “overpriced”.

On the other hand, the Mac Pro is not a thing of beauty, it spends the majority of it’s life tucked under a desk and it’s primary purpose is to be fast. Unsurprisingly Mac Pro’s are stupidly more expensive then a home built counterpart and as with any Apple product, you ain’t going to be able to replace/upgrade it cheap…[/quote]
All the price is in the case/design.
Open up some apple shit and there’s just the same hardware in it as others.
Buying apple products is just retarded their a hige ripoff

Read full topic

item.title: Most overpriced products?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

That’s the same reason a lot of these things are overpriced, someone spent time developing them and now wants to make money on them. The reason apple makes a lot of money is not because the products are amazing (because they really arent much better than counterparts), but it’s because they’ve become a popular brand that people ‘want to have’ to fit in. They know they can milk people for a ton of money, so hell, why not? They’re a company after all.

Read full topic

item.title: Most overpriced products?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Davidi2:

Apple products aren’t in this, must be bad

Well to be honest, expensive macbooks, ipads, iphone’s etc are understandable. Although it might not fit everyone’s taste, all these products are a marvellous piece of design - it’s debatable whether these products are “overpriced”.

On the other hand, the Mac Pro is not a thing of beauty, it spends the majority of it’s life tucked under a desk and it’s primary purpose is to be fast. Unsurprisingly Mac Pro’s are stupidly more expensive then a home built counterpart and as with any Apple product, you ain’t going to be able to replace/upgrade it cheap…

Read full topic
